slides.title: Learning Objectives
slides.content:
By the end of this module, you will be able to:

  1. Detect edges using gradient-based methods
  2. Find corners and interest points
  3. Apply the Hough transform for line/circle detection
  4. Understand feature descriptors (SIFT, ORB)
  5. Perform feature matching between images

slides.title: Canny Edge Detector
slides.content:
Canny Edge Detection - The "optimal" edge detector:

  1. Gaussian smoothing - Reduce noise
  2. Gradient computation - Find edge strength and direction
  3. Non-maximum suppression - Thin edges to 1 pixel
  4. Hysteresis thresholding - Connect strong and weak edges
Produces thin, well-connected edges with good noise rejection.

knowledgeCheck.question: What is the purpose of non-maximum suppression in Canny edge detection?
knowledgeCheck.answer: Non-maximum suppression thins the edges to 1 pixel wide by keeping only the local maxima along the gradient direction, removing pixels that are not at the peak of the edge response.

slides.title: Corner Detection
slides.content: Interest points for matching

slides.title: Harris Corner Detection
slides.content:
Harris Corner Response:

$$R = \det(M) - k \cdot \text{trace}(M)^2$$

where M is the structure tensor. R > 0 indicates a corner.

slides.title: What Makes a Good Feature?
slides.content:
Good features are:

  • Repeatable - Found in both images
  • Distinctive - Unique in neighborhood
  • Localized - Precise position
  • Efficient - Fast to compute
Flat Region
No change in any direction
❌ Bad feature
Corner
Change in all directions
✓ Good feature

slides.title: Hough Transform
slides.content: Detecting lines and shapes

slides.title: Hough Transform
slides.content:
Hough Transform: Convert from image space to parameter space.

$$\rho = x \cos\theta + y \sin\theta$$

Each edge point votes for all lines passing through it. Peaks indicate detected lines.

knowledgeCheck.question: How does the Hough transform detect lines even with gaps or noise?
knowledgeCheck.answer: Each edge point independently votes in parameter space. Even if the line is broken by gaps or noise, enough points along the line will vote for the same (ρ, θ) parameters, creating a peak that can be detected.

slides.title: Feature Descriptors
slides.content: Describing local image regions

slides.title: SIFT Features
slides.content:
SIFT (Scale-Invariant Feature Transform):

  • Scale-space extrema detection
  • Keypoint localization
  • Orientation assignment
  • 128-dimensional descriptor

Robust to scale, rotation, and illumination changes.

slides.title: ORB Features
slides.content:
ORB (Oriented FAST and Rotated BRIEF):
  • Fast keypoint detection (FAST)
  • Binary descriptor (BRIEF)
  • Rotation invariant
  • Free alternative to SIFT
  • Much faster than SIFT

slides.title: HOG Features
slides.content:
HOG (Histogram of Oriented Gradients):

Captures edge direction distribution in cells. Excellent for pedestrian detection and object recognition.

slides.title: Texture Features
slides.content: LBP and other texture descriptors capture local patterns

slides.title: Advanced LBP
slides.content: Local Binary Patterns: Compare center pixel to neighbors, encode as binary number. Fast, robust texture descriptor.

slides.title: Feature Matching
slides.content: Finding correspondences between images

slides.title: Feature Matching
slides.content:
Matching strategies:
  • Brute-force: Compare all pairs
  • FLANN: Fast approximate matching
  • Ratio test: Reject ambiguous matches

knowledgeCheck.question: What is Lowe's ratio test and why is it effective?
knowledgeCheck.answer: The ratio test compares the distance to the best match vs the second-best match. If the ratio is below a threshold (e.g., 0.75), the match is accepted. This rejects ambiguous matches where multiple features look similar.

slides.title: Bag of Features
slides.content:
Bag of Visual Words:

  1. Extract features from training images
  2. Cluster into visual vocabulary
  3. Represent images as histograms of visual words
  4. Use for image classification/retrieval

slides.title: Implementation
slides.content:
import cv2
import numpy as np

img = cv2.imread('image.jpg', 0)

# Canny edge detection
edges = cv2.Canny(img, 100, 200)

# Harris corners
corners = cv2.cornerHarris(img, 2, 3, 0.04)

# ORB features
orb = cv2.ORB_create()
keypoints, descriptors = orb.detectAndCompute(img, None)

# Feature matching
bf = cv2.BFMatcher(cv2.NORM_HAMMING, crossCheck=True)

slides.title: Summary
slides.content: Key Takeaways

slides.title: Key Takeaways
slides.content:
1. Edge detection: Sobel, Canny - find boundaries
  2. Corner detection: Harris - find interest points
  3. Hough transform: Detect lines and shapes in parameter space
  4. SIFT/ORB: Scale and rotation invariant descriptors
  5. HOG/LBP: Gradient and texture features
  6. Feature matching: Brute-force, FLANN, ratio test
